name: San Antonio Marriott Rivercenter

reviews.text: The Marriott Rivercenter in San Antonio is attached to Rivercenter, a somewhat down-at-the-heels shopping mall that is currently undergoing a major renovation. It does have a 9-screen multiplex movie theater and an IMAX theater, as well as a food court and its own comedy club. The Riverwalk, San Antonio's biggest attraction after the Alamo, is just steps from the hotel entrance -- and the Alamo is one long and one short block away. The hotel itself is large and modern, with a Starbucks in the lobby. Staff were universally courteous and helpful. The exercise room is fairly well equipped, and has a large whirlpool and indoor-outdoor pool. My room, with a king size bed, was not especially large but big enough; the bathroom was modern, and the bed very comfortable. My only complaint was the presence of a few small ants that occasionally could be found creeping along the night tables. The hotel has its own restaurant on the second floor, and a cafe by the pool, but I did not eat at either one and so cannot comment.
reviews.title: Convenient, comfortable hotel in San Antonio

reviews.text: As with other reviewers, I appreciated the helpful staff from the front desk to housekeeping. I was there for a conference for 5 days and this was a great location, providing convenient access to restaurants and other activities after long day sessions. The conference food service was great as well. We had breaks and one lunch (the grilled chicken was excellent) provided by the hotel catering service, and a step was not missed with such a large crowd. The room was nicely appointed, and the free wi-fi access in the lobby was handy (extra cost in the room). Recommend the Maria Mia restaurant (exit hotel at riverwalk, down the steps and you're there) for anyone, and their takeout meals are just as delicious, enough for two, and reasonably priced. The mall with it's Food Court is available, and you can even catch a visit to the Alamo after meetings are concluded. Recommend a boat ride which was fun and cheap, but ask for discounts such as military and senior citizen's. Appreciate the hotel providing taxi estimatefor trip from airport on its website. My cab driver quoted more, but when I told him that wasn't the estimate I got, he took me the most expedient route, and it was right in the range of the estimate, rather than 8-10 dollars more as he had quoted. He wasn't as friendly after that, but I saved!
reviews.title: Choice for Business or Pleasure

reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but since the staff at Marriott Rivercenter blew me away I thought it was time. I went with a girlfriend for an easy out of town getaway. Just wanted to sit by the pool with no agenda. What could have been just an ordinary hotel stay was made incredible by all the staff at Marriott Rivercenter. They really understood and delivered exceptional customer service. They were at 90% capacity but really went out of our way, remembering our names, drink orders and reason for staying despite the hectic atmosphere. Willis from the bell station, Felipe from the pool bar and all the bar tenders at The Bar were just phenomenal. Their restaurant manager James really went out of his was and for all their great attitudes I wanted to write a review, turning an ordinary trip into a great resort experience. (Though hotel is not a resort) Hotel was clean, rooms were comforable and the pool was a nice rooftop experience. Food was unexpectadly great.
reviews.title: Exceptional Staff at Marriott Rivercenter

reviews.text: We arrived and were well treated by the Bellmen. When I went to check in I was told I didn't have a reservation which was alarming. I always carry my confirmation and gave it to the desk clerk and was assigned a room. The room was pretty clean except for a dirty sock and a speeding ticket on the floor from a previous occupant. The problem with the room was it's size. This was a king bed room and had a desk, desk chair and a padded chair. The Padded chair was within 12 inches of the bed which made it a hazard when getting up during the night. As a result I moved it. For the price we paid we expected a little more.
reviews.title: Small rooms and questionable service

reviews.text: The staff of the Marriott Rivercenter are wonderful. I stayed there six days as part of a conference and had a chance to interact with many of their employees. From the room service to the front desk to housekeeping, everyone was extremely helpful. The facility was beautiful and the fitness center / indoor pool were fantastic.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service

reviews.text: the perfect place to stay in san antonio.next to the river walk and close to all restaurants and clubs. little but nice open pool.
reviews.title: very nice hotel and cool location

reviews.text: We booked this hotel with Marriott destination points and basically only stayed here because it was free and the points expire if we don't use them. The room was nicely updated and was a typical Marriott room and did have a nice view. We usually stay at the Hyatt or in that area of the Riverwalk and I prefer that area to the location of this hotel as most of the restaurants with nice patios on the Riverwalk are much farther down. I don't mind walking, but with 4 kids in tow and in the July heat it is not as enjoyable. I noticed hookers were hanging out in the bar / lobby area one night when we returned to the hotel. This hotel gets a lot of business travelers and I'm sure this is why they are hanging around, but they need to crack down on this!
reviews.title: Okay hotel, not great with kids

reviews.text: This is a great place to stay it is central to most of the best things to do in San Antonio, Tx. The hotel service was great and took very good care of me.
reviews.title: Great Service, very nice location and hotel.

reviews.text: Spent a short week at the Marriott Rivercenter for a business conference. Conveniently located near Civic Center, other Marriot, and on the Riverwalk. A mall is connected to this hotel, but it doesn't not intrude on the hotel.
reviews.title: Good Location for San Antonio Business Trip

reviews.text: The hotel was pricey, about $200 per night in August (it was 104 deg. every day), and there was no wet bar or fridge in the room (why cheap out on this?) and I had to pay for Internet each day :-( . At this price, I would have expected these two items included.
reviews.title: Amazing views

reviews.text: The room was clean. That was the only positive attribute of the hotel. The only employees in the hotel that provided good customer service was the gentlemen at the concierge desk. (Also our maid was polite.) Every where else, the restaurant, check-in desk, etc. they seemed indifferent.
reviews.title: Not "customer friendly"

reviews.text: The Marriott Rivercenter is a great property you would expect from Marriott. However, this
reviews.title: Great location, Great facilities

reviews.text: hotel has one of the BEST hotel gyms I have seen. It even has a Smith machine! It is conveniently located on the Riverwalk for easy access and is connected to a local mall for
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay until....

reviews.text: any shopping you need to do. Has all the amenities you need for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at a beautiful hotel, but there are better parking options.

reviews.text: Bars, UPS business center, Starbucks, etc... Room was clean and service was great.
reviews.title: Excellent Friendly Service

reviews.text: This hotel is undergoing renovations. Noisy hammering and drilling from approximately 7 AM to approximately 5 PM, sometimes so loud I can't hear the TV. Impossible to concentrate and get any work done. This is outrageous considering I'm the price I'm paying for this room. Only relief when complain is that they'll give me some "extra points." They say renovation noise is a problem in all the rooms so changing rooms is not gong to do me any good. Not likely to stay at a Marriott in the future so extra points are worthless to me. Wired internet $12.95 per day - and even higher at business center. There are lots of better places on the Riverwalk to stay in than this place.
reviews.title: Noisy Renovations -- Hammering, Drilling -- All Day Long

reviews.text: DON'T stay at the Marriott Rivercenter if you have any kind of conscience where an employer's cost is involved.
reviews.title: Abusing expense accounts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DON'T stay if you like anything besides ESPN (about 4 or 5 varieties) or CNN.
reviews.title: Great location, but don't use the valet service! Use Self Parking!

reviews.text: DON't Stay if you don't have lots and lots of money to waste.
reviews.title: Location only benefit. They charge for internet access!

reviews.text: I checked in to the Marriott Rivercenter, and check in was seamless. The room was spotless and comfortable. The front desk service was flawless and quick.
reviews.title: An adequate experience

reviews.text: This hotel has very small rooms and the walls and doors are paper thin we are on the 19th floor and had a great room but the other guests on this floor must think its a college dorm, there was yelling and laughing and slamming doors till well after 2a.m., I know this isn't the hotels fault and we are here for a major concert, but even as I type this I can hear the ppl in the room next door and have heard 3 doors slam, I believe this is do to the outdated rooms. There are several other places I have stayed and will do so again on the river walk before this one.
reviews.title: Don't stay looking for sleep

reviews.text: Got through Priceline so excellent value. Pool was closed. No jacuzzi . Friendly staff. There is an indoor shopping mall attached. Close to the Riverwalk attractions . Would stay there again . Very comfortable bed
reviews.title: Convenient to Roverwalk

reviews.text: The hotel was great, and the staff was incredibly friendly. Outstanding customer service and every employee we interacted with (parking, front desk, pool, housekeeping, restaurants) was wonderful, and went above and beyond.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location can't be beat - right on the river, attached to the mall (we had rain so this worked out well), easy walk to the Alamo and many other attractions / shopping / restaurants. The room was a little small, but comfortable, clean and quiet. Great bed and pillows. The pool is heated, indoor / outdoor, and salt water, so it's easy on your eyes and skin, and great for kids.
reviews.title: Rivercenter has struck an Iceberg that could sink it!

reviews.text: The only downside was the parking. We called the valet desk prior to checking out, in order to request the car, and I was told they had forwarded the line to the front desk so we'd need to bring the slip down to the valet before they could get the car. Not a big deal, but then it took over 45 minutes to get the car from the time we gave the slip to when the car arrived. This was way too long of a wait, and completed negated the convenience of the valet parking, which was pretty expensive.
reviews.title: Outstanding service

reviews.text: This Marriott has always been a favorite of ours...location is great for business as well as pleasure. We have now discovered that this Marriott location has now become a favorite location for conventions, other than the one we come for. Therefore, the elevators are very slow and the noise level has really gone up all night long. The staff does what it can accomodate all of us. Room requests are not honored as before. We will continue to stay here most likely.
reviews.title: Nice...nice...nice

reviews.text: Ultra-convenient to downtown River Walk (adjacent to River Walk and the indoor Rivercenter Mall). The mall has all the basics including a food court. Other restaurants nearby. Strarbucks in the lobby of this hotel.
reviews.title: Easy with children; convenient to downtown... indoor/outdoor pool

reviews.text: We stayed here due to a wedding and were very pleased. The catered food for the hotel including some of the best steak I've eaten in my life --- quite a statement since the food was produced in mass. The ballroom was beautiful -- not a standard box with bland walls and ceiling. Likewise, a reception dinner in the restaurant (name = ?) on the 2nd level was very good. The breakfast buffet was not cheap ($20 perhaps?) but very good. Service (especially Annette) was top notch -- very, very good. She helped us with little things like special order hot chocolate for our son that made it all possible and pleasant.
reviews.title: Somebody needs to SPEAK to the Restaurant Mgrs @ Personality & Leadership!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Elevators are reasonably fast. Rooms had good size.
reviews.title: Little Piece of Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one annoying feature of this hotel was that we ordered in advance a roll-away bed, extra towels, etc. The items were not in place when we arrived. We ultimately had to call down to have them deliver them. It is irritating when they go through the trouble to ask of any special requests in advance, we comply and then they don't do anything with the information/request we submitted.
reviews.title: Great location, clean and friendly

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference. I was able to check in at 1 PM despite the advertised 4 PM check in time. The room was clean, beds were very comfortable. The staff were very accommodating to my roommate who had special requests. The only negative thing about the room was the bathroom configuration. The tub and toilet were in one room with the sink and mirror on the outside. I did not like having to leave the bathroom to wash my hands or look in the mirror. The water temperature in the shower was difficult to regulate. The gift shop was somewhat disappointing...minimal things for children. I unfortunately did not have opportunity to use the pool. Located on the river walk is an added bonus!!
reviews.title: Very convenient to the convention center

reviews.text: clean rooms. helpful staff. parking is a little pricey and it a bit difficult to maneuver in when you have a large vehicle. the indoor and outdoor pools were good, just filled with lots of children. the breakfast was the best...! and the mall being right downstairs is not bad either... i really enjoyed my stay here and i will be back soon.
reviews.title: i really loved this place.

reviews.text: I just returned from a business conference at this hotel. Everyone at some time has stayed at a marroitt, however this hotel has to be one of their flagship hotels. The location is perfect , on the river walk and attached to the trendy river walk mall. It is about 1/4 mile walk to the Alamo, and great restaurants and shops. The area is in a tourist / business area and very safe.
reviews.title: Has to be flagship hotel for marriott

reviews.text: The outside landscaping is flawless. I can't say enough about the outside cleanliness .
reviews.title: Excellent Service and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering the property , the concierge quickly , friendly, and attentively , checked me in and answered any questions regarding the hotel. As a matter of fact, any time I approached the front desk, I was treated the same by each employee. Obviously, the all have received extensive training.
reviews.title: Nice hotel / Good location

reviews.text: High rise hotel located on the Riverwalk and connected to a small mall. This is a "convention" hotel that supports meetings both in the hotel and next door in the Convention Center. That said the hotel was found to be up to Marriott standards: room was clean, shower hot, staff helpful. There are several restaurants just outside the door on the river side. No complaints, would stay there again. Park across the street in the City parking garage for $9 vice $27/day at hotel.
reviews.title: just the facts, ma'am

reviews.text: I have had the pleasure to stay at several fine hotels along the atmospheric San Antonio Riverwalk but, this hotel is PRIME. It's prime for location which is central to shopping, riverboat rides, convention center, the Alamodome, the Alamo, a diverse selection of restaurants according to your culinary delights Texas style. The restaurant selection is reasonable for high or low budgets. Within the atmospheric area of this hotel are many families so, it has wholesomeness.
reviews.title: In this Riverwalk area this is PRIME...

reviews.text: Try it you will like it... San Antonio Marriott Rivercenter
reviews.title: Great Family Fun!

reviews.text: The Hotel is a bit confusing as far as where to go, it almost felt like a maze. I went there with my kids and they were super excited. The staff was friendly and we had great service. The location has to be my upmost favorite part of the Hotel. So close to great food, great attractions and walking distance from the Alamo. Housekeeping was impecable as well! They really took care of us and even hung up our bathing suits to dry (I had no idea that the shower had a retractable hanging line!). I felt at ease. Two big thumbs up.
reviews.title: Excellent...until we tried to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was great; very clean! Check in was quick and the clerk was friendly. The location is perfect for anything you want to do in downtown San Antonio. However, all of the excellent service came to a screeching halt when we were obtaining our car from valet. We called "At Your Service" for the car and was told it would be brought around. So we went downstairs and waited...and waited...and waited. No one ever asked us if we had been helped. Finally I went to the valet stand and asked if our car was en route. It had never even been put on the list! Instead of expediting the service, which we paid $33/day for, by the way, the attendant said she would "add us to the list." By then it had been 25 minutes. Finally, 35 minutes after the initial call, our car arrived and again, the gentleman "helping" us was not friendly. Very disappointing and irritating end to what otherwise was a great weekend.
reviews.title: Convienent location, comfotable rooms, friendly staff, a little noisy

reviews.text: Nice hotel - only spent one night - requested early check in and high floor room and got both. Loved being able to go right out onto the Riverwalk and catch the boat tour. Ate at the restaurants right outside and enjoyed those as well. Overall good.
reviews.title: Rivercenter Marriot

reviews.text: This Marriott is obviously in the center of things for the tourist and conventioneers that come to San Antonio. Everyone from the bell hops to the front desk were helpful and attentive. Our only complaints were the size of the rooms (smaller than most Marriott rooms I've stayed in) and the bar drinks ($16 for a Patron margarita with mostly ice - are you kidding me?).
reviews.title: Location-Location-Location

reviews.text: We spent a week here and was very pleased overall. The hotel staff were wonderful and met all of our needs. The location was great, we didn't have to get in the car and drive anywhere if we didn't want to. The beds were comfortable. The pool is small for the size of hotel but it was so hot we didn't care.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The price for parking was high but I guess that is to be expected for the great location. We will definitely stay here next time we come to Sam Antonio.
reviews.title: A few Nights on Riverwalk

reviews.text: Great Place to stay while visiting San Antonio ,A few steps out the door and you are at the Famous Riverwalk, We had a fabulous time, Everone we encountered at the River Center was very cordial, It is within walking distance to the Convention Center
reviews.title: Overall very good, pass on Food, a little too Crowded in weekends

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott Rivercentre for a business trip over the weekend of Aug 10-13th. The hotel entrance is easily accessible and there is both self park and valet available - watch out for the big Texas trucks in the hotel entrance!!
reviews.title: Outstanding location on the Riverwalk

reviews.text: The lobby area is bright and airy, with a Starbucks on site and helpful concierge service. The rooms are slightly smaller than we're used to, but they are well layed out and completely modern; everything you'd expect a Marriott to be.
reviews.title: Very nice and perfect location
Rivercenter Marriott
reviews.text: We had absolutely no complaints during our stay. The staff is very friendly and attentive; must be that Texas charm.
The pool is indoor/outdoor and there is a very well equipped gym; better than most hotels.
reviews.title: Perfect location - Riverwalk and Mall

reviews.text: This hotel is in a fantastic location. It is attached to the Rivercenter mall and is right on the Riverwalk. Everything you need to explore San Antonio is at your fingertips if you stay here.
reviews.title: Good Service, Great Staff: Amenities came at expense.
Fantastic weekend
reviews.text: This hotel is all about service and it is excellent. We owe a special thank you to Tyrone at the check in desk. He is a model employee.
We had the breakfast buffett Sunday morning and there were many choices. It is on the Riverwalk so easy to get in and out. Also Next to the Rivercenter shopping area.
reviews.title: Great staff..property improving!

reviews.text: If you choose this hotel, you will not be disappointed
reviews.title: Convention Hotel - Needs A Lot of Improvement
Wonderful time, wonderful memories!
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a week; the staff is welcoming and helpful. I do agree that there is construction noise, and we asked for a room on the newly re-done floors, to accomodate that. By the 3rd day, the noise on floor 26 was Very minimal, and there was more noise from other hotel guests. and at that. not much!

Parking rates are Very typical for not only Marriott hotels, but for the San Antonio area. downtown; they know people come to see the Riverwalk/Alamo, so the make money in parking..Any city does the same! If you come to S.A. just for that area, I would Not rent a car--everything is accessible either walking, or with the inexpensive downtown trolley system. The airport is also close, so taxi fare is not outrageous.
reviews.title: Expensive - You (almost) get what you pay for...

reviews.text: The hotel itself was nice - lobby was great, my room was nice but I was not happy about the customer service and the elevators that I have to give this hotel only a 2 star.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but subpar customer service from management

reviews.text: When I checked in, the front desk manager was extremely rude to me. I have Marriott status but was told that this particular Marriott does not consider status when putting you into a room. I was put into a room that faced directly at the Hyatt and made me feel super claustrophobic and had to switch rooms. The staff is not knowledge about the layout of the hotel and don't know what views the rooms have. This was not a cheap hotel so I expected some sort of customer service here.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and service

reviews.text: The elevators took a really long time - up to 40 minutes! I went back to my room to pack to find the same people still waiting for the elevator! I finally got onto one and the squeaking was so bad that I had to get out of the elevator because I really thought it was going to break down. I almost think not all the elevators were working because the wait was so ridiculous. The starbucks line downstairs was understaffed as well.
reviews.title: Good choice with convenient access

reviews.text: Rather typical Marriott property. Room was fine as was the service. Nice city views from the upper floors. Convenient location for downtown. Only a block walk to the Alamo. Abundant restaurants nearby. Free boarding pass printing from the computer kiosks outside UPS center on the ballroom floor. About $30 cab ride from the airport.
reviews.title: Very quiet and relaxing!

reviews.text: We visited San Antonio for a sporting event and stayed at the Marriott Rivercenter since we tend to like Marriott and it was conveniently located to the Riverwalk, mall, and shuttle we needed to get to the sporting event. The check-in was quick and friendly with no problems at all - in fact we were able to check in early. The room on the 25th floor overlooked the pool and edge of Riverwalk, and it was a typical Marriott 2 bed room. It was clean, with a modern tv, but didn't have a fridge because we forgot to request one. I had to have a large package shipped to the hotel, and they received it although I didn't realize it would cost $7.50 for that service (not that it would have prevented me from shipping it, they just didn't mention it when I inquired about sending a package). There are some good deals at "The Bar" - one afternoon I got the turkey sandwich with a glass of Chardonnay for $11.00 and it wasn't bad. The Starbucks in the lobby is convenient but has long lines in the morning so plan accordingly. There are plenty of comfy chairs in the lobby where you access the free WIFI if you don't want to pay the extra fee to get it in your room. You can walk to the mall right from the hotel, close to the Macy's side. Overall I would say that it was a pleasant stay and I'm glad the air conditioning worked well because it was suffocatingly hot in San Antonio in July.
reviews.title: Quite good

reviews.text: The only good thing about this hotel was it's location. It is right next to the River Center Mall. Other than that....not so much. Our room was to warm even with the air blasting. If you want to use the internet it costs $12.95 per day. The TV reception was awful for the few times at night we wanted to watch a movie....including the one we bought for $17.00. The water did not get cold. The walls were to thin....could hear everything. The staff were friendly. And parking cost $25 per day. Will never stay at a Marriott again.
reviews.title: No Amenities

reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend stayed this past memorial day weekend. It was the nicest hotel I had ever stayed in- very roomy and clean. The only thing I would have changed was the positioning of the air vent. It was right by the window facing the wall and not towards the main area. We like a cooler room so the vent pointing the opposite way of the bed didn't allow the air to circulate throughout the room and so the room didn't cool off as well. Besides the air vent- it was perfect!
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay!!

reviews.text: Great location, outstanding staff in every aspect, great facilities. I had a reservation elsewhere and was disappointed when I arrived, so went "hotel shopping" after canceling my other reservation. I was hesitant upon arriving at the Marriott Rivercenter because the hotel was hosting two large conventions that weekend and the lobby was mobbed. But the front desk staff went out of its way then (and all throughout my stay) to make me feel welcomed and gave me great personal attention. And that level of attention was evident everywhere from the concierge to the maid service to maintenance (who arrived twice during my stay to tend to a problem I didn't know I had - the maids had reported that my "on-demand' movie channel, which I never use anyway, had less than perfect quality). Even late at night when I inquired about a special cable for my laptop someone arrived at my door within minutes to see what I needed, and came back within 15 minutes meeting my unusual request. I can't speak to the quality of the standard rooms as I was upgraded as a platinum elite, but everything in my rooms was perfection. What made the stay truly noteworthy was even though the hotel was packed with convention goers, I was never inconvenienced and the staff made me feel like I was the only guest in the hotel. My only small disappointment (and I mean really silly picky small) was that the evening food service in the concierge level lounge was only "OK to good", and not "good to excellent" as comparable Marriott properties elsewhere (though the staff there was very attentive). Sorry if that last part makes me sound like a hotel snob!
reviews.title: Could not have been better

reviews.text: Oh yeah one other thing, if I had to pay the daily service for the WiFi (which I don't as an elite member), I'd find it a total ripoff in this day. Listening Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt, Westin?
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: But my last two comments would in no way stop me from enthusiastically recommending this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay for a Platinum Member

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights while attending a conference at the San Antonio Convention Center. Very Close to the convention center--about a 5 minute walk--and right on the river walk mall. Also within walking distance of the Alamo and La Villita district. Overall, the location of this hotel can't be beat, however I found my room to be stale smelling and a bit dingy. For the price paid (>$200/night), I would expect a fresher, more updated room. The bathroom was a good size but the sink area was very small and I did not have enough room to put my make-up and toiletries. I don't know if it was just my room, but both the shower and faucet sprayed water instead of producing a nice stream. This was especially annoying at the sink because it got all of my belongings wet. The toiletries provided are nice; I believe they were from Bath and Body works. The bed was very comfortable. It had a plethora of pillows and a fluffy down comforter and I slept very well every night.
reviews.title: Comfortable and well located

reviews.text: I used the fitness center twice and it was to my liking. I was able to get a very good workout in since the gym was surprisingly well equipped with a variety of weight and cardio machines. However, around 6am the gym got busy and all cardio equipment was being used.
reviews.title: Nice staff and Hotel near to everything

reviews.text: There is an internet connection in all the rooms but you have to pay $12 for it. If you go down to the 1st or 2nd floor, you can connect to the free wi-fi which saved me 3 days worth of internet fees.
reviews.title: Pricey but nice place

reviews.text: There is a restaurant in the hotel which I did not eat at, as well as a bar and Starbucks in the lobby. I would stay here again if on business but I think it's too expensive for a personal stay.
reviews.title: Wish they had told me....

reviews.text: I really like the hotel. I was with my wife for a conference. The staff was nice and accommodating the needs. The only thing I missed was the pool but we went to the Marriott next door for relaxing. The hotel rooms are fine but not to mention the Grand Hyatt have a better view for the Tower, city, and river. Marriott will give you good views of the city. As I mentioned the staff was very accommodating, we got a free Wi-Fi for our last night stay. For parking, two streets away, $5 a night. And please do not rent a car from Avis, the guy is shady and do not disclose the terms in simple terms. I was stumped with hefty price for the gas tank. Oh yeah the riverwalk gets huanted on the weekday nights.
reviews.title: Close to the River walk, great customer Service

reviews.text: My room was on the side of the hotel facing the mall. There was a group at the Riverwalk playing wind music all afternoon (how many times can you stand the theme to "Titanic"?) -- they were positioned to maximize the acoustics from the enclosed walk and the adjacent hotel tower. I was on the 23rd floor and could hear the music as if it were in the room. I asked one of the staff and they said the musical group is there all day, every day.
reviews.title: Annoying, loud music

reviews.text: The internet connection was $12.95 per day -- which would have been OK if it worked. it failed several times.
reviews.title: Same old, same old

reviews.text: Stayed at this property for a convention. The rooms are standard Marriott, split bathroom (sink oustide), and smallish room size. They charge $12.95 /24 hours for in room wireless internet, but wifi is free in the lobby, where you are hard pressed to find a sitting spot during a convention. The hotel is 1 block from convention center and adjacent to Rivercenter shopping mall, and about a 5 min walk from main Riverwalk restaurants.
reviews.title: Perfect for a River Walk Stay

reviews.text: Restaurant reccomendations: Acenar for a modern take on Mexican(Houston st on the river), Mi Tierra for typical mexican, they also have a huge bakery and the place is worth the visit for the Xmass tree decor ( 5 min , $5 cab ride) on Market Square, and Tre Tratoria for laid back non traditional Italian and great drinks ( next to la Villita , across from the Convention Center) 5 min walk from hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This hotel was very convenient for a convention but I would probably pick somewhere else the next time
reviews.title: great stay in San Antonio

reviews.text: This hotel was centrally located and had excellent amenities. The convention facilities and catering was exceeded my expectations. The only negative experience was the bed,they were extremly uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Great for Business and Conventions

reviews.text: Nice hotel and wonderful location.. Only bad thing about it was the check-in staff...Rude...Rude...Rude.....Will NEVER stay there again. Loved that the Riverwalk was just outside the door and the Mall. Rooms were nice; but weird shaped. Housekeeping was wonderful and very friendly.
reviews.title: RUDE STAFF

reviews.text: I had a five night stay at the Marriot Rivercentre in August for a conference. The hotel easily meets its 4 star standard and likely won't disappoint.
reviews.title: Ideal for a first time trip to San Antonio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My late evening check-in had problems. I had reserved a king sized bed and called the hotel to advise them of my late check-in time. When I arrived, the front desk agent told me that there were no king sized beds left. They were willing to move me the next day and had me relocated by 10 a.m. to the room I would stay in for the duration of the trip.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: As for the room, it was ideal for a business stay, though rather corporate contemporary bland. The bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows. The room air conditioning was perfect --discreet and kept the room at an even temperature. Shower pressure was adequate and there were basic Bath and Body Works toiletries. The mini refridgerator kept beverages at a frosty temperature. In room wi-fi and wired internet was strong, although you pay for the access.
reviews.title: Loved it, will definitely stay there again!

aka: San Antonio Marriott Rivercenter Hotel San Antonio
